name: Jean-Georges Vongerichten’s Ginger Vinaigrette
description:
This recipe is an adaptation of one found in Jean-Georges Vongerichten’s and Mark Bittman's cookbook, “Jean-Georges: Cooking at Home with a Four-Star Chef.” 

Fresh ginger, lime juice and sherry vinegar are the star players in this simple, sophisticated dressing that will make any salad sing. After putting it together, let it rest for a day so the flavors can meld.
recipeIngredient: 1 2-inch piece of ginger, peeled and roughly chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a blender, using plenty of black pepper. Add 1 tablespoon warm water and blend until dressing is emulsified. Best if left to rest for a day before using, to enhance flavors.
